## About me

I am a [postdoctoral research fellow](https://connects.catalyst.harvard.edu/Profiles/display/Person/202432) at Harvard School of Public Health and Brigham and Women's Hospital, exploring network models for multiomic data.

## Key Publications

+ [DRAGON](https://arxiv.org/abs/2104.01690) is a new tool for multi-omic Gaussian graphical modeling. DRAGON lives in the [Network Zoo](https://netzoo.github.io/) and is available as part of [netZooPy](https://netzoopy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/). Citation: **Shutta, K.H.**^+^, Weighill, D.^+^, Burkholz, R., Guebila, M.B., Zacharias, H.U., Quackenbush, J. and Altenbuchinger, M., **2022**. DRAGON: determining regulatory associations using graphical models on multi-omic networks. *arXiv preprint* arXiv:2104.01690. ^+^: equal contribution

+ Our recent [tutorial](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/sim.9546) on Gaussian graphical models is a great starting point for applied statisticians to get up and running with GGM analyses. You can find a stand-alone RMarkdown document with the tutorial code [here](https://github.com/katehoffshutta/ggmTutorial). Citation: **Shutta, K.H.**, De Vito, R., Scholtens, D.M. and Balasubramanian, R., **2022**. Gaussian graphical models with applications to omics analyses. *Statistics in medicine.*

+ [SpiderLearner](https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.07.13.452248) is an ensemble approach we've developed for estimating Gaussian graphical models. Citation: **Shutta, K.H.**, Balzer, L.B., Scholtens, D.M. and Balasubramanian, R., **2021**. SpiderLearner: An ensemble approach to Gaussian graphical model estimation. *bioRxiv,* https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.07.13.452248.

+ We have identified and validated [11 metabolites associated with chronic psychosocial distress](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.psyneuen.2021.105420) using data from the NHS, NHSII, and WHI. Citation: **Shutta, K.H.** ^+^, Balasubramanian, R. ^+^, Huang, T., Jha, S.C., Zeleznik, O.A., Kroenke, C.H., Tinker, L.F., Smoller, J.W., Casanova, R., Tworoger, S.S., Manson, J.E., Clish, C.B., Rexrode, K.M., Hankinson, S.E.^++^, and Kubzansky, L.D.^++^, **2021**. Plasma metabolomic profiles associated with chronic distress in women. *Psychoneuroendocrinology*, 133, p.105420. ^+^, ^++^: equal contribution
